page.title: 16LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape around Eastnor is {generally hilly and picturesque, as it lies on the south-west end of the Malvern Hills.Its scenery is that of{grazing pasture and farm land. The parkland area around Eastnor Castle is particularly attractive. The land is mostly very fertile but is clay and poor for crop growing and farming by White House farm.In the Sitch wood area the ground is soggy and suitable for sheep only.In the second field by Sitch wood there is a windpump which unfortunately stopped working three years ago.In the park there are six hundred deer and sheep. The ground by the Obelisk is hilly and unsuitable for cattle.Around Bronsil Castle there is marshland.Much of the area is wooded and there are fine examples of rare trees in the Castle grounds.
